messages: e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:05): will it be possible to place for example div tag within video tag?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:05): as fallback for browsers which don't support <video>, yes
e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:07): iam just thinking of youtube that has "comments/links" withing the movie. I though of doing the same with div.
e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:08): But its to use layers then
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:08): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: How long did it take you to get to the lake?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:08): Can you use video with imagemaps?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:10): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: well, my bike back wheel was flat when I got the canal
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:10): I have no idea how long it was
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:11): heh
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:11): I got back to my bike at 8pm, but I spent a fair bit of time at the lake napping or taking photos on the way
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:12): ended up more or less falling asleep at 5pm, oddly
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:12): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: It is about 5km from the town centre to the lake
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:13): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I know taht
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:13): Which is just over an hours walk
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:16): I tend to walk slower in the heat though, so probably a bit more than that for me
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:20): apparently today I have taken some exceptionally wonky photos
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:20): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: So does everyone I guess
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:21): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: I seem to have done that over the past week too :(
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:21): has lots of photos that he should, or should not, upload
e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:21): If i want to get the state of the video with javascript (example: stopped, playing, paused ect). Where can i find it?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:21): and also lots of pictures which are the pictoral qequivalent of me going "wow!  big expanse of flat, uninteresting land"
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:21): which at the time I was obviously quite excited by, but I'm not so sure why now
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:22): :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:22): It is somewhat impressive quite how big the expanses of flat uninteresting land are though.

e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:23): Iam thinking. If i dont like the custom controls or i want to use my own controls. I could do so with placing divs within the video overlayed. And with javascript activate and change blablabal..
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:23): yeah, hard to capture with a 50mm lens though
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:23): e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/video.html#dom-media-paused
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:23): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: You have 350D, right?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:23): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: aye
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:24): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: This is when the 10‚Äì22mm comes into use :P
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:24): e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3: and the surrounding section
e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:24): mm, i will find
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:24): I have lots of photos that are the pictoral equivalent of "I got the wrong camera settings. Again."
e862bf3550c1ed74374b6cb7492e51f3 (22:24): I just thought of making my own controls
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:25): is tempted to get one of the Sigma fisheyes designed for APS-C sized sensor cameras
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:25): is tempted to get many things but can't afford most of them
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:25): tends to be too conservative and boring to run into that often
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:26): Sure is deja vu on public-html lately
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:29): isn't it always?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:29): It wasn't the first time each issue was discussed
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:30): but after the second and third and fourth etc times, it does get a little tedious

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:32): Perhaps if the issues were captured and resolved on a wiki with permalinks, they could be quickly dismissed with URLs to those permalinks when brought up the second and third and fourth times (or at least new information could be added instead of rehashing).
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:32): http://microformats.org/wiki/wiki-better-than-email
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:34): I don't think it's lack of knowledge that's the main problem

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:35): thinks the volume of communication (email and IRC and blog posts and blog comments and ...) is high enough that it's unreasonable to expect people to follow it all, and one can't expect them to not repeat earlier discussions unless there's a brief summary they can refer to to see that it's been said before
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:35): More of a "They don't agree with me yet, they must've missed it the previous time, so I'll just say it again until it works"
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:36): (From all sides involved)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:41): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: the key is can you make it valid in both encodings. those examples all have at least one conformance error (e.g. unknown attributes) in at least one of the encodings.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: So it has to be conforming HTML, not just a valid byte sequence in the given encoding?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:41): right
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:42): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: the point is to highlight these issues to authors
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:42): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: so if the author gets a conformance error, that's enough
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:42): imho
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:43): i've made 2022 discouraged like utf-32 and ebcdic
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:43): i understand it's actually used quite widely, at least for e-mail and maybe for web
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:44): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: i also tweaked the text to make utf8+names not ascii-compatible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: btw, you probably don't want your classes and so forth to have the "5" in their name
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:47): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: the nsHtml5 prefix is supposed to go away
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:47): so as it happened, I was too much of a newbie with hg to do the landing right and now more experienced people are cleaning up the mess I caused
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (22:48): oh, you're landing it on trunk?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Is <meta charset=&quot;utf-8>+names"> conforming (in both encodings)?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:56): It doesn't have any unrecognised attributes now, unless I'm being stupid
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:57): http://philip.html5.org/data/charsets.html#charset-iso-2022-jp - hmm, that seems to be used quite a bit
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:57): utf-8+names isn't ascii-compatible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:57): so <meta charset can't be used with it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:57): in a conforming page
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:58): I thought the idea was to have an example that justifies the inclusion of that ASCII-compatibility requirement
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:59): so it just needs to conform to all other requirements
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:59): no the idea is to have an example that justifies changing the encoding sniffer to bail as soon as it hits a byte sequence that might screw things up
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:00): or changing the ASCII-compatibility requirements to exclude even ascii bytes in later parts of multibyte sequences
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:09): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Hmm, what about <meta charset=\x0Eutf8>x\x0Fiso2022kr>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:09): which is also <meta charset=ÊúÆÔ¶åÏóÜiso2022kr>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:10): how is that valid in 2022?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:11): 0x0E and 0x0F are escape codes in iso-2022-kr (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1557)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:12): Oh, I suppose there's the problem that ÊúÆÔ¶åÏóÜiso2022kr isn't the preferred name for that encoding
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:12): right
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:12): or any name for it as far as i can tell
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:13): I thought anything [^a-zA-Z0-9] gets stripped when comparing names
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): hm i guess it would compare correctly, yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): but it's still not valid
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:13): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: http://www.flickr.com/photos b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f/3668544285/ ‚Äî Now I'm not sure it is worth it.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): it's also not valid in UTF-8, is it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:14): U+000E is a parse error
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:14): i'm glad you're having as much trouble as i was with this
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:14): makes me feel like i'm not a moron :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:14): and btw these encodings are insane

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:15): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I'm guessing it's more fun if you actually get to the lakeside, but I didn't because I wasn't quite sure how far down the road the lakeside was

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:31): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: If you want the document to be valid UTF-8 then it can't contain any non-whitespace bytes < 0x20, so it seems impossible to do anything interesting with any ISO-2022-* encodings, so I suppose that's a lost cause
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:32): (unless I'm wrong)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:32): that's more or less the conclusion i drew too
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:32): i was playing with comments to hide some of the bytes, but yeah, even that wouldn't hide 0x1B.
